article_title: Secrecy of Oil-by-Train Shipments Causes Concern Across the U.S.
article_text:
Emergency responders in Cincinnati know that trains full of crude oil have been rumbling through their city; they can see mile-long chains of black tank cars clacking across bridges over the Ohio River.

But they don't know enough to feel prepared for the kinds of fiery accidents that have occurred over the last 10 months after oil-train derailments. How many of the 100 trains that pass through residential neighborhoods and warehouse...

twitter.description: Secrecy has cloaked the rapidly expanding business of shipping crude by rail, leaving local officials from Portland, Ore., to Toronto struggling to obtain details about oil shipments.
twitter.title: Secrecy of Oil-by-Train Shipments Causes Concern Across the U.S.

image.alt: Public-safety officials typically have no idea when explosive oil is moving through their towns by train

twitter.creator: @russellgold
